intro: Euphrasia tatarica var. brevipila, commonly known as the short-stemmed tatarian eyebright, is a perennial herb native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, reaching a height of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense spikes. This variety is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
